messages:
Ever seen seven men rolling a 4,000 litre wooden beer barrel? 

The brewery coopers line the wooden barrels with pitch to stop the wood’s flavour imparting into the beer. When that barrel is enormous then it’s a big job for the team to ensure the whole of the inside of the barrel is covered in the pitch. And that means rolling it around their yard #NaZdravi. Pitching the Beer Barrel.

Meet Josef, Head Cooper, responsible for all the brewery's wooden barrels

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/people-pilsner-urquell-josef-hruza. People of Pilsner Urquell: Josef Hruza. What's it like to be a cooper at the brewery?
This was taken in 1900. Coopers have built and maintained wooden barrels at the brewery since 1842 – in fact, the processes have barely changed at all in that time. Timeline Photos.

Before stainless steel, beer was matured in and served from wooden barrels. Coopers made and maintained those barrels. At their peak in Plzen, we had over 250,000 small wooden barrels and 7,000 large ones, with 150 men working in the cooperage.

We still have a team of coopers at the brewery today. They still make small barrels and large ones for the beer that we still make and drink like we did decades ago. Here’s the coopers’ story http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/coopers-and-wooden-barrels. Timeline Photos.

Can you imagine a time when there were 7,000 large wooden barrels in our brewery cellars and the action in this video was a daily sight in the coopers’ yard?

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/large-wooden-barrels. Building a Large Wooden Barrel.

You can’t just cut down a tree and turn it into a wooden barrel. This is how our coopers choose the Czech oak for their barrels

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/selecting-perfect-wood-beer-barrel. Selecting the perfect wood for a beer barrel.
What do you get when you combine seven skilled Czech craftsmen, a lot of Czech oak and a month of hard work? Building a Barrel in Seven Steps.

The coopers’ yard in 1928. Each of these wooden barrels held over 2,000 litres of Pilsner Urquell and was built and maintained by hand. We still employ coopers today and they still build those big barrels by hand. Timeline Photos.
Using Czech oak, built by hand, and filled with beer, wooden barrels are the heart of our brewery #NaZdravi. Pilsner Urquell: Barrels and Brewing.
Raise a beer to Josef Hruza, Head Cooper. In charge of wooden barrels and keeping the craft of coopering alive in the Czech Republic #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

Ever wanted to know what the numbers on our wooden barrels mean?

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/numbers-barrels. The Numbers on the Barrels. Like a secret code, these numbers tell our brewers everything they need to know about the beer inside the barrels. But what do they mean?
Ever wondered how we put Pilsner Urquell into wooden barrels in 1928? Wonder no more! This is down in the brewery cellars where all the packaging took place. Timeline Photos.
It’s a monumental task to build a 3,000 litre barrel of beer – and a real challenge even for our master coopers as we put barrels at the heart of the brewery.

Ever been inside an empty 3,000 litre wooden barrel? That’s something our coopers have to do when they’re building the large barrels. Here’s a teaser for a longer video that’s coming soon! TEASER: Building the Barrel.

Aside from our barrels, did you know the coopers sharpen their craftsmanship on ornate, smaller wooden pieces?

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/coopers-workshop. From the coopers' workshop. With ornate wooden cup and tankards, there's more to the coopers than just big barrels!
The coopers add pitch to a large wooden barrel. Pilsner Urquell's cover photo.

The barrels in the brewery cellars are all chalked with different numbers. But what do those numbers actually mean? 

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/numbers-barrels . The Numbers on the Barrels. Learn the code the brewmasters use to know exactly when the beer is ready to drink.
The coopers here at the brewery are in the middle of building a new 38 hectolitre wooden barrel (that's 3,800 litres - it's big!). This is how it looked this morning. Timeline Photos.

All the wooden barrels used for unfiltered beer events are handmade by our coopers in Plzen. Did you know it takes 4.5 days for one cooper to build one barrel? That’s proper craftsmanship! Timeline Photos.

How do we re-pitch the huge wooden barrels from the brewery cellars? Just like this!

http://youtu.be/Kr7GqFAjV0U
http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/pitching-barrels. Pilsner Urquell: The Pitching of the Barrels. Have you ever seen five guys rolling a giant oak beer barrel? Twice a year the coopers at Pilsner Urquell re-pitch and roll the barrels ready for fresh beer....

Twice a year our coopers remove the large wooden barrels from the brewery cellar and then re-pitch and roll them.

Pitch is made from tree resin which is heated to 200°C. This is then added to the inside of the barrel – we do this to ensure the beer doesn’t come into contact with the liquid and thereby changing the flavour of the beer.

But with such large barrels and such high temperatures, the process involves the coopers working together to roll the wooden vessels to get an even spread of the pitch.

Want to know more about the process and why we do it? Read it here: http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/pitching-barrels

Or see the video of the whole amazing process: http://youtu.be/Kr7GqFAjV0U. Pitching the Barrels.

For hundreds of years, wood was the material in which beer was universally stored and served from. It was the job of the coopers to make and maintain the barrels needed in breweries. By the 1970s, stainless steel kegs began to replace wooden casks, yet at Pilsner Urquell we've continually employed coopers for over 170 years and continue to mature and serve some of our beer from these wooden barrels. Here's some images of the coopers from past and present.

Have a look at this video of the barrels and the barrel makers: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k6GtHMDFvbs

And read more about the coopers here: http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/coopers-and-wooden-barrels. The Pilsner Urquell Coopers.

Wooden barrel events in London

Please enjoy Pilsner Urquell responsibly. Visit www.TalkingAlcohol.com for more info. Wooden barrel events in London.

summary: From the old brewhouse and into the new one, this is where we brew the original Pilsner #NaZdravi.
One of the coolest things in the brewery is the original tank used for the first ever brew of our beer.
The original Pilsner and still brewed the original way #NaZdravi.
We still brew the original Pilsner in the original way, and that means using copper tanks #NaZdravi.
The original Pilsner is still brewed the original way.
messages: What's inside the Beer Master's safe? It's 100 years old and has held many great brewery secrets.
First brewed on 5 October 1842, the original batch of Pilsner beer was presented to the people of Plzen on 11 November 1842, exactly 174 years ago today! #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
This is Plzen, our home. 174 years ago we were getting ready to brew the first ever batch of golden lager - and we've been brewing it ever since that day #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

"We want to give back a small part of the old Berlin." Years ago, families would picnic on the island garden. Today, Inselgarten is bringing people back with great beer and a great leisure and cultural space

pilsnerurquell.com/article/inselgarten-berlin. Inselgarten, Berlin. It's one of the most scenic places to drink Tankovna Pilsner Urquell and it harks back to the island's leisure grounds of 100 years ago.

From the old cellars and up into the new brewhouse, join Total Ales as Brewmaster Jiri shows them how Pilsner Urquell is made

http://www.totalales.co.uk/blog/2016/7/28/pilsner-urquell-brewmaster-jiri-fusek. The Pilsner People – Chapter 5. The Brewmaster: Jiri Fusek.

These are the people who make Pilsner Urquell. They make it the same way as generations of brewers and maltsters and coopers have done it before them, ensuring the original golden lager is still brewed the original way #NaZdravi. People of Pilsner Urquell.
The original Pilsner is still brewed the original way. The only changes in 174 years have been with the different artworks. Have a favourite? Timeline Photos.
Hello from Plzen, where we brew the original Pilsner in the original way #NaZdravi. People of Pilsner Urquell.
From the old brewhouse to the new one. We still brew the original Pilsner in the original way, and that means using copper tanks #NaZdravi. Original Brewhouse.
Here's one from the archives and the brewery yard over 70 years ago. Love the designs on the old trucks in the back! Timeline Photos.

The original Pilsner is still brewed the original way and there are no better judges than the past and present brewmasters, who have made and drunk the beer for decades, to ensure the taste of our beer never changes #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
Follow the light! Prazdroj, Plzen. The original Pilsner and still brewed the original way #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

Every year we produce 10 special bottles which are auctioned to raise money for the charity Centrum Paraple. This year’s glass was prepared by the artist Lenka Husárková and well-known Czech designer Bořek Šípek. The auction takes place on 17 December on idnes.cz. Timeline Photos.
The Original Pilsner is 173 years old today and still looking fresh! #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

“Exclamations of awe were heard when its golden hue shone underneath the snow-white cap of froth; then the drinkers cheered its crisp, delicious taste, the likes of which they had never tasted before.” This is how the people of Plzen reacted to their first taste of the town’s new beer, which happened exactly 173 years ago today #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

Tanks a lot! We still have the copper tank that Josef Groll used to brew the first batch of Pilsner. We might not use this tank anymore (it's 173 years old...) but we do still use copper and we do still heat it using a direct fire. That’s important in brewing the original Pilsner, the original way. Timeline Photos.

It wasn’t a coincidence that the first brew of Pilsner Urquell happened on the 5 October 1842 #OriginalPilsner

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/why-did-first-brew-happen-5-october-1842. Timeline Photos.

Plzen’s citizens built their brewery near to a perfect source of soft brewing water. Today we still use the same well of water in Pilsner Urquell: http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/pilsner-urquells-water. Plzen's Brewing Water (in 30 seconds)

Beer o'clock? Not quite. But later we'll be raising one to Prague's astronomical clock, 605 years old today! 

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/google/google-doodle/11919530/Prague-astronomical-clock-the-oldest-of-its-kind-is-605-years-old.html. Prague astronomical clock, the oldest of its kind, is 605 years old. Prague's astronomical clock is more than half a millennium old, and is the oldest functional clock of its kind in the world. Google has celebrated its anniversary with a Google Doodle.

173 years ago today, Josef Groll brewed the first ever batch of Pilsner at the new Citizens’ Brewery in Plzen. Today we still brew the #OriginalPilsner in the original way. #NaZdravi to that! Timeline Photos.
This poster is over 100 years old but we all still understand that feeling, right? #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

The first brew of our beer was made in this copper tank – it’s one of the greatest artefacts in our brewery. Today we still brew the original way and still use copper tanks #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
From the old brewhouse and into the new one, this is where we brew the original Pilsner #NaZdravi. Brewhouse Hyperlapse.
This is a poster from the 1950s. The design of our new heritage bottles take inspiration from the bottle depicted in this advert as well as others from the last century #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
The original Pilsner. The first Pilsner. Born in 1842 and still as fresh as ever #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

In 1842 we brewed the world’s first golden lager…

…and we never stopped #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
Here come the bottles! #PilsnerWorld. Timeline Photos.

In 1842 the first ever brew of Pilsner Urquell was made in a copper tank.

And we’ve been using copper ever since #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
Time for a label from the archives! This is another one which is over 100 years old. Can you guess the year it's from? #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
The design of our labels has evolved over the years. This is more than 100 years old. Can you guess the year? #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
“A whole town brews it, a whole world drinks it, all smart places serve it" Love this artwork our old US importers used years ago!  #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
Every golden grain used to brew Pilsner Urquell is made in our maltings next to the brewery in Plzen. And we've done it this way since 1842 #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
Here’s a great shot from the brewhouse earlier today. Did you know that we’ve used copper vessels to brew Pilsner Urquell ever since 1842? #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
It takes the world’s best hops to brew the world’s first golden pilsner. Timeline Photos.
Here in Plzen we've always brewed Pilsner Urquell with our city's soft, natural water, making it an essential ingredient in the original Pilsner #NaZdravi. Pilsner Urquell's Water.
This is the original line where we used to fill bottles of Pilsner Urquell. Guess the year this photo was taken? Timeline Photos.
So what makes Plzen’s water so perfect for brewing Pilsner? Pilsner Urquell's Water.

Glassmaker Miroslava Kupčíková created just 10 of these beautiful bottles which we’ve auctioned for the charity Parable, raising an amazing 720,000kc (over €25,000). The buyers get to take their bottles into the brewery cellars and fill them up. Something for the Christmas list! Timeline Photos.
Imagine seeing this golden Pilsner for the first time ever. That happened exactly 172 years ago today when the people of Plzen got the #FirstTaste of their town's new beer. Timeline Photos.

172 years ago, Josef Groll would’ve taken a candle down to the cellars when he was having the #FirstTaste of his new beer. Here's why we've always had a candle in the cellars... Pilsner Urquell Cellar Candle.

Remember your first good beer? What was it? The #FirstTaste of Pilsner Urquell happened on 11/11/1842, so 172 years ago today brewmaster Josef Groll was preparing to share his new beer with the town of Plzen for the first time. Timeline Photos.
On 5 October we celebrated the 172nd anniversary of our #FirstBrew. Here's how we brew Pilsner Urquell, which is the same way we've always brewed it. Pilsner Urquell: How We Brew.
It might have been 172 years ago, but we still have the copper tank from our first brew in 1842. Join us this weekend as we celebrate our #FirstBrew. Timeline Photos.
The beer hasn’t changed since 1842, but the bottle and label has. Which one would you choose? Timeline Photos.
One of the coolest things in the brewery is the original tank used for the first ever brew of our beer. That copper is looking good for being over 171 years old! Timeline Photos.

Scientists have figured out the importance of water in making a good cup of coffee… Thankfully we discovered that secret many years ago and have always used the same soft water from Plzen to brew our beer!

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/health/healthnews/10875537/Secret-to-perfect-cup-of-coffee-lies-in-the-quality-of-the-water-researchers-say.html . Secret to perfect cup of coffee lies in the quality of the water researchers say - Telegraph. The secret to a perfect cup of coffee may lie in the minerals in your tap water, researchers have found.

In 1842 we brewed the world's first golden lager... And we never stopped

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fuH1JB9NLTY . Pilsner Urquell: Still Brewed In Plzeň. We brewed the world's first golden pilsner in 1842 and we never stopped. Pilsner Urquell is still brewed in the same brewery the same way. Here's a video abo...
Loving this old American poster for Pilsner Urquell! What a great tagline: "A whole town brews it. A whole world drinks it. All smart places serve it." Timeline Photos.

111 years ago Pope Leo XIII requested some Pilsner Urquell. A batch of beer was blessed and sent to him and since then we’ve often sent beer on the same journey.

Today the beer was blessed by Frantisek Radkovsky, Bishop of Plzen, during a sending-off ceremony at the brewery. Soon 2014 bottles – it's always the number of bottles as the year we’re in – will be going to the Vatican. Timeline Photos.

171 years ago to this day our original brew master, Josef Groll,  brewed the first batch of a new golden larger, now known as Pilsner Urquell. Take a look at this specially designed Pilsner Urquell birthday cake. Timeline Photos.

Craft. Culture. History. Heritage. These are the things that make up the world of Pilsner Urquell, and our anthem. Watch it here: http://youtu.be/9JjxBF2nVSk. Pilsner Urquell: Still Brewed In Plzeň. We brewed the world's first golden pilsner in 1842 and we never stopped. Pilsner Urquell is still brewed in the same brewery the same way. Here's a video abo...

Happy New Year, Šťastný Nový Rok!
Happy New Year!
Šťastný Nový Rok or Happy New Year!
Happy new year from Pilsner Urquell.
messages: Štastný Nový Rok or Happy New Year! #NaZdravi. Happy new year from Pilsner Urquell.
Krásné Svátky and Happy Holidays! Timeline Photos.
Šťastný Nový Rok or Happy New Year! Here’s to a great 2016 #NaZdravi. Happy New Year!
#NaZdravi, Šťastný Nový Rok and Happy New Year from Pilsner Urquell. giphy.com.
Here’s to a great 2015. Happy New Year, Šťastný Nový Rok! Timeline Photos.

Today Czechs hand out painted eggs in a wide variety of colours and designs as gifts. Lamb will be the Easter meal for many followed by a lamb-shaped sponge cake. Small buns with raisins and cinnamon are the special Easter snack.

Happy Easter! Timeline Photos.
Happy Halloween. Timeline Photos.
"Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy." - Benjamin Franklin. Timeline Photos.

summary: Saaz Hops and Pilsner's Foam.
Pilsner Urquell Saaz Hops.
The smooth foam of a perfectly-poured Pilsner catches all of the amazing aromas of Czech Saaz hops – the finest hops in the world!
The finest hops in the world, Saaz gives our beer its fine aroma and bitterness #NaZdravi.
This is how the Czech Saaz hops get from the hopbine to our brewhouse and into your beer glass #NaZdravi.
messages: Czech Saaz hops are special. We use a lot of them in the our beer, giving a deep bitterness and fresh aroma. The foam on the beer helps hold onto all of that hop flavour when you drink it #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

Did you know that hops help to build a beer’s foam? We use A LOT of Saaz hops to ensure we get that smooth, creamy foam (and also the great Saaz aroma and taste, of course!) #NaZdravi. Saaz Hops and Pilsner's Foam.
Czech Saaz hops are our 'green gold'. The finest hops in the world, Saaz gives our beer its fine aroma and bitterness #NaZdravi. Pilsner Urquell Saaz Hops 2016.
Did you know: The smooth, sweet foam combines perfectly with the bitter Saaz hops and that's what gives the refreshing balance which makes Pilsner so great with food. Timeline Photos.
We use Saaz hops in our #OriginalPilsner. Grown just 80km from the brewery, they give our beer its distinctive (and delicious) flavour. Timeline Photos.
The Saaz hop harvest is happening in Žatec right now! This is where all the hops for our beer will come from (and this is a favourite photo from a couple of years ago) #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
The annual Saaz hop harvest has begun! Yesterday the Beer Master was there to check out the quality of the finest Czech hops! Timeline Photos.
The smooth foam of a perfectly-poured Pilsner catches all of the amazing aromas of Czech Saaz hops – the finest hops in the world! #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

The 'Mliko' pour of Pilsner Urquell is WAY more than just a glass of foam - think of it like a dessert, a treat, where the wet foam is smooth and creamy and gives you all the great Saaz hop flavour. giphy.com.

A Saaz single-hopped Pilsner? We’ve done it that way since 1842 #OriginalPilsner

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/pilsner-urquell%E2%80%99s-hops. Pilsner Uquell Saaz Hops.

The Czech Saaz hops, which give our beer bitterness and aroma, are being harvested now. Last summer we filmed the whole process and spoke to the hop farmers #NaZdravi. Pilsner Urquell: Saaz Hop Harvest.
This is how the Czech Saaz hops get from the hopbine to our brewhouse and into your beer glass #NaZdravi. Pilsner Urquell Saaz Hops.
Have you ever seen hops being harvested? We went to see it in Zatec, where all of the Saaz hops used in Pilsner Urquell are grown.
TRAILER: Love hops? Here’s a teaser... More coming soon to https://www.youtube.com/user/PilsnerUrquellGlobal.
While you’ve been looking on Facebook, we’ve been in Zatec picking the Saaz hops we use to brew our beer with. Check out these photos from the harvest! Saaz Hop Picking 2014.

The hop harvest is coming soon, so do you know your Saaz from your Simcoe?! And do you have a favourite hop variety?

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/know-your-hop-varieties. Know your hop varieties! We love hops!
We believe in hops. Do you? Timeline Photos.

summary: Order a Pilsner in the Czech Republic and this is how it’ll be poured for you (because Czechs know that Pilsner tastes better with foam) #NaZdravi.
Pilsner Urquell tastes better with foam.
It tastes – and looks – better with foam #NaZdravi.
It's the classic Czech way of serving Pilsner Urquell #NaZdravi.
Pilsner Urquell tastes better with foam… and Christmas lights!
messages: Every great serve of Pilsner begins with a cold, clean glass #NaZdravi. giphy.com.
It's unbelievable, really, because Pilsner Urquell tastes better with foam. Once you've tried a proper, perfect pour of Pilsner then you know this is true #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
Pilsner Urquell tastes better with foam… and Christmas lights! #NaZdravi. giphy.com.
When the foam laces down your glass you know you've got a well-poured beer. Insist on foam. It tastes better that way #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
Drink like a Czech! One gulp and you'll understand why we say that Pilsner tastes better with foam #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
If your Pilsner isn't poured like this then it's not being served properly. Ask for a proper Czech pour. It tastes better that way #NaZdravi. Hladinka Pilsner Urquell Pour.

The thick foam on Pilsner Urquell is 'wet' foam. It's poured by the special Pilsner tap that we have and it works differently to the 'dry' foam on most other beers. Watch this Czech Hladinka pour and you'll see how the foam actually becomes beer. Foam is good. Pilsner Urquell tastes better with foam. Hladinka: Pilsner Urquell's classic Czech pour.
If the glass is clean and the beer is properly poured then you'll always get great lacing left behind. It tastes – and looks – better with foam #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
Order a Pilsner in the Czech Republic and this is how it’ll be poured for you (because Czechs know that Pilsner tastes better with foam) #NaZdravi. giphy.com.
Pilsner Urquell tastes better with foam. It's how we've always served it in the Czech Republic #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
This is the 'Hladinka' pour. It's the classic Czech way of serving Pilsner Urquell #NaZdravi. giphy.com.
Don't be frightened of the foam - a Pilsner tastes better this way! #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
A beer with dinner? #NaZdravi. giphy.com.
A great glass of Pilsner begins at the brewery and ends with the bartender’s pour #NaZdravi. giphy.com.
Celebrate the Tapster! All day long they pour perfect glasses of Pilsner Urquell #NaZdravi. giphy.com.
It’s always a fine sight to see a fresh Pilsner placed in front of you #NaZdravi. giphy.com.
Pour yourself a glass of beer #NaZdravi. giphy.com.
Everyday he turns that tap again and again, always pouring the perfect pint #NaZdravi. giphy.com.
“Nothing ever tasted better than a cold beer on a beautiful afternoon with nothing to look forward to than more of the same.” - Hugh Hood. Timeline Photos.

summary: The perfect Pilsner pour is #BetterWithFoam.
The Perfect Pilsner Urquell Pour.
The classic Mliko pour of Pilsner Urquell is all sweet, smooth foam - a perfect dessert beer #NaZdravi.
The perfect Pilsner pour starts with smooth foam and then the beer follows.

This is the Czech "šnyt" pour 

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/classic-pilsner-pour-%C5%A1nyt.
messages: Golden lager and creamy white foam. Perfectly balanced and always refreshing. #BetterWithFoam. Timeline Photos.

Hajnovka is a Prague pub where locals know they can always enjoy a perfectly poured Pilsner paired with hearty Czech food. #NaZdravi
http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/prague%E2%80%99s-best-pubs-hajnovka-3 Timeline Photos.

The perfect Pilsner pour starts with smooth foam and then the beer follows. Foam captures all the great Saaz hop aromas and keeps your beer fresher while
you drink #NaZdravi. giphy.com.
Petr is a Tapster. His job is to pour Pilsner Urquell perfectly every time. He will show you how Czechs demand their beer to be served #NaZdravi.

“I’ve learnt you need to ensure four things are correct: temperature, pressure, cleanliness and service. If even one part isn’t precise, then it all breaks down.” Prazdroj, Bratislava. At Prazdroj in Bratislava you can guarantee one of the finest, freshest glasses of Pilsner Urquell because everything from the beer to the tap are perfectly calibrated to ensure a perfect pour.

For drinkers in other countries the appearance of the Hladinka – which has a lot of wet foam – might be a little surprising, but Czech lagers aren’t supposed to be poured the same way other beers... Classic Pilsner Pours: Hladinka. Go to Czech Republic, ask for a Pilsner, and a Hladinka is what you'll get. This is the typical Czech Pilsner pour. Learn more here!
Here's one way we can guarantee a white Christmas! The classic Mliko pour of Pilsner Urquell is all sweet, smooth foam - a perfect dessert beer #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
The perfect Pilsner pour: foam first then fill the beer from below the head. The foam keeps the beer fresher and tasting smoother #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
These Tapsters love pouring perfect Pilsners for you but sometimes the beer is too good to share! #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

This is Martina, one of the Brewery Bartenders. "To be a good Tapster you have to love beer. But just drinking a lot of beer doesn’t make you an expert. I’m always learning." Perfect Pilsner Pour: Martina Navrátilová. "I am the girl who understands beer better than some of the men sitting across the bar!”

But what have wet hands got to do with a perfectly poured Pilsner? Veronika will tell you... 

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/perfect-pilsner-pour-veronika-mik%C3%A9skov%C3%A1. Timeline Photos.
If you're in Czech and you ask for a Pilsner, this is what you'll get. The perfect Pilsner pour is #BetterWithFoam. Perfect Pilsner Pour: Hladinka.
Brilliant white foam, thick and smooth, with a neat line on top of the golden Pilsner. Beautiful beer perfection! #Betterwithfoam. Timeline Photos.
He nearly dropped these glasses when we said that some people want their Pilsner without foam! #BetterWithFoam. Timeline Photos.
Foam rings left on your glass? That's great! Properly poured Pilsners leave foam lacing as you drink #BetterWithFoam. Timeline Photos.
The three Pilsner pours. How do you like yours? #TankBeer. Timeline Photos.
A Pilsner poured without foam?! That's just not Czech #Betterwithfoam. Timeline Photos.

"I think the women softly care about the beer. We have more love. The man pours it harder." Veronika teaches people to pour perfect Pilsners and she notices the small differences in how they do it. Here's her story...

pilsnerurquell.com/article/perfect-pilsner-pour-veronika-mikésková. Perfect Pilsner Pour: Veronika Mikésková.
We told this Tapster that some drinkers outside of the Czech Republic want their Pilsner without foam. This was his reaction! #Betterwithfoam. Timeline Photos.

It's unthinkable to serve a Pilsner without the foam in the Czech Republic. The Hladinka pour – or Smooth – is how we do it.

Here's the story: http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/classic-pilsner-pours-hladinka. Drink it like a Czech. Have a Hladinka. When you order a Pilsner, make sure you get a proper pour and drink it like we do.
Now this is a perfect Pilsner pour, exactly as you get it in a Czech pub. Always demand that your Pilsner looks like this because it tastes better with foam #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

'Not a large beer and it's not even a small beer.' Ever had the unusual Czech 'Šnyt' pour of Pilsner Urquell? 

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/classic-pilsner-pour-%C5%A1nyt. Classic Pilsner Pour: Šnyt. A small beer in a large glass with a great story.
Here's how we create the crisp bitterness in the Na Dvakrat pour (and wait until you see how the foam turns into beer!) #betterwithfoam. Na Dvakrat Pour.
Think of mliko like a beery dessert. And you need to drink a mliko quickly before that sweet, smooth foam turns into beer! #betterwithfoam. Mliko Pour.

The three classic Pilsner pours: Na Dvakrát, Hladinka and Mliko. Each has a different amount of foam, different carbonation and qualities, and each is delicious in its own way! #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
Here's how the classic Czech pour works (and see how all that wet foam turns into more great beer while the foam stays thick on top. Perfect!) #betterwithfoam.
The perfect pilsner pour is not the same as the best pour for other beers #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
The perfect Pilsner pour begins with a clean, cold, wet glass and ends with a smile on your face #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
The brewer brews our beer but it’s ‘made’ at the bar with a perfect Pilsner pour. It tastes better with foam. Fancy one? #NaZdravi. The perfect Pilser pour.
This is how we express love in the Czech Republic #NaZdravi. Milan's Perfect Pilsner Pour.

A small beer in a large glass topped with foam and a good story. This is the Czech "šnyt" pour 

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/classic-pilsner-pour-%C5%A1nyt. Classic Pilsner Pour: Šnyt. "The Šnyt is a popular compromise between ‘have one’, and ‘don’t have any’. It is at least something more than nothing, even if it isn’t a full glass”.
We Czechs will only settle for a beer that's perfectly poured. Petr will show you: Pilsner Urquell: Petr's Perfect Pour.

'The Golden Eagle’ in Plzen was one of the first pubs to pour Pilsner Urquell. Meet Vaclav Mirwald, the tavern's owner: http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/v%C3%A1clav-mirwald. Václav Mirwald and The Golden Eagle. Mirwald was heard saying “We must have good, affordable beer!” in his quest to have his town brew great beer for him to serve in his tavern.

A small beer in a large glass with an interesting story. This is the traditional Czech “Šnyt" pour #NaZdravi 

pilsnerurquell.com/article/classic-pilsner-pour-šnyt. Classic Pilsner Pour: Šnyt. "The Šnyt is a popular compromise between ‘have one’, and ‘don’t have any’. It is at least something more than nothing, even if it isn’t a full glass"
Now this is how a perfectly poured glass of Pilsner should look! #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

The best pour of Pilsner Urquell begins with a clean glass #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
Beermaster Robert Lobovsky knows the perfect Czech-style pour of Pilsner Urquell. Thirsty? #NaZdravi. The Perfect Pilsner Urquell Pour.

messages:
“Most people come to Vienna for love. I came for the love of beer!” 

Brian Patton is making exciting things happen for beer in Vienna, with Tankovna Pilsner Urquell at the heart of his excellent pub, The Brickmakers Pub & Kitchen. The Brickmakers, Vienna. “That tanker drives 325km from Plzen to here. I know that and that means something to me. We’re in Vienna. Our neighbour is Czech.”
Drinking #Tankovna Pilsner Urquell? The beer is as fresh in your pub as it is in our brewery #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

Love Tankovna Pilsner Urquell? This beer is unpasteurised and delivered direct from the brewery to tanks in the pub, meaning it’s the freshest beer you can get outside of Plzen and the closest we can get to the experience of drinking in the brewery cellars. And soon you can get it installed in your home! #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

Tank Beer. Tankovna. The Pilsner Urquell in these is unpasteurised, it’s driven straight from Plzen to the pub, and it tastes as fresh from the tank as it does at the brewery #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

The Brewery Cellars.

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/brewery-cellars .

Stretching out over 9km in length, and sloping to depths of between 12-22m, the extensive network of cellars beneath the Pilsner Urquell brewery have played a key role in the history of the beer and the city.
messages: This is 'The Chapel.' Explore with our Beer Master the original ice cooling system used in the brewery cellars.
In the darkness of the brewery cellars, there's something devilish protecting our beer….

If you've been to our brewery then you'll know this incredible sight. If not then have a look around the brewery cellars, where we still make beer and mature it in these huge barrels #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

How did you keep 9km of cellars and over 7,000 barrels of beer cold before artificial refrigeration? You cut huge blocks of ice from frozen lakes and stacked them into over 50 underground ice houses. This is how and why: http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/cooling-cellars. Timeline Photos.
Follow us down into the brewery cellars... Brewery Cellar Hyperlapse.

This is why we still make beer in the cellars beneath the brewery...

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/parallel-brewing. Parallel Brewing at Pilsner Urquell. Why do we have wooden barrels filled with beer in the brewery cellars?
We still make beer in large wooden barrels in the brewery cellars. But why? http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/parallel-brewing. Timeline Photos.
This was 1943 in Plzen when it took four guys to move the big barrels down into the brewery cellars #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
From the brewery cellars and into your beer glass #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

Our brewery cellars are naturally cool but during the summer months they weren’t quite cold enough, so we had to come up with a way to ensure a consistent year-round temperature. And that involved ice.  Here's the story:

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/cooling-cellars. Cooling the Cellars.

With its delicate balance of oily, herbal tones from Czech Saaz hops, creamy, butterscotch flavoured body and crisp, bitter finish, it’s on... It's the malt that we produce ourselves in Plzen that gives the original Pilsner its bright, golden colour #NaZdravi.

The bitter hops in Pilsner give a peppery quality which matches the spices in sausages, while the sweet malt in the beer loves the flavours in pork. This is a timeless and great match for Pilsner! Timeline Photos.

It’s #NationalBurgerDay! What’s the best burger to go with a Pilsner Urquell? Find out here: http://youtu.be/pcQ8BmdX9kM. Timeline Photos.

Czech cheese and beer ketchup? We think these make the perfect burger toppings for a Pilsner Urquell.

Now we want to try your suggestions, so what would your perfect burger be to go with Pilsner Urquell?

http://youtu.be/pcQ8BmdX9kM. The Perfect Burger for Pilsner Urquell. Tell us what your perfect burger would be!
Picture yourself with mates, drinking Pilsner Urquell. Which of these Limited Edition cans are you holding? Timeline Photos.
Here’s to the end of the week and the beginning of the weekend. Na Zdravi! Timeline Photos.
Hungry? What beer would you want with this classic Czech feast? Timeline Photos.

Ever wondered how we get the beer from our tanks and into your glass? This is what the packaging lines look like at the brewery in Plzen, where we fill bottles, cans and kegs (including 5 litre mini kegs). We also recycle and reuse many of the green bottles. The Packaging Lines.
What a brilliant old Pilsner Urquell poster from 1896! Timeline Photos.
Some drinks are best served with attention to detail. Timeline Photos.
Pete, our correspondent in the brewery, was recently in Plzen to see these four tanks loaded onto the van ready for the drive to London! Where would you like to see them installed? Timeline Photos.
Been looking into the brewery archives this afternoon and found this super snap: it's what beer deliveries looked like in Plzen in 1902 – love those big wooden bottle crates! Timeline Photos.

We’ve chatted with food psychologist Greg Tucker and asked him what he thought about the taste of Pilsner Urquell in relation to other beers. What he came back with is fascinating – we’ve never seen flavour mapped out like this before! Timeline Photos.
We’ve been thinking long and hard about what we want for Christmas and have realised we have everything already: the best beer and friends in the world! Veselé Vánoce! Timeline Photos.
The clocks go back, the Pilsner Urquell comes out. Timeline Photos.
The home of the original Pilsner. Timeline Photos.
Na zdraví. Timeline Photos.
“We are the music makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams.” Timeline Photos.
There's no place like home. Timeline Photos.
Seeing in the weekend with a cool pint of Pilsner Urquell. Timeline Photos.

As author David Day once said: “If God had intended us to drink beer, He would have given us stomachs.” Here's an instruction manual from the 20th century explaining how to efficiently drink Pilsner Urquell. Timeline Photos.
“Beauty lies in the hands of the beer holder” – Anonymous. Timeline Photos.
We agree with Greek philosopher Plato when he said: "He was a wise man who invented beer" Timeline Photos.

messages: Have you seen our brewery restaurant Na Spilce? It's the largest restaurant in the Czech Republic. It's a place where the Pilsners are always fresh, delicious and perfectly poured. #NaZdravi! Timeline Photos.
This is important: Pilsner should be served in a cold, clean, wet glass. Demand the perfect pour #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

We talk about the perfect Pilsner pour because we want everyone to drink the beer when it's at its best. We make sure the beer is brewed perfectly, the rest happens when your Tapster pours it #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.
The perfect Pilsner pour! #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

summary: The People of Pilsner Urquell.
He's one of the tour guides at the brewery in Plzen and we think that he knows everything there is to know about Pilsner Urquell!
That's the beer you drink in the brewery cellars at the end of the tour (you can also get it in Na Parkanu in Plzen and very occasionally in other places).
This is what he’s seen happen in the years that he’s been with us http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/people-pilsner-urquell-jirka-koranda.

This Life in Trips has written this great piece about his visit (it's going to make you thirsty...) #NaZdravi

http://www.thislifeintrips.com/pilsen-pilsner-urquell-brewery-tour-review/ The Grandfather of Beer: Pilsner Urquell Brewery Tour.
messages: This is the central courtyard of our brewery. Come and have a 360-degree spin around and see some famous sights. Timeline Photos.

"People have a high expectation when they come here. We can’t disappoint them. People know this place for the beer quality.” U Bláhovky, Brno. This is U Bláhovky, a small Brno bar with a huge reputation for excellent Pilsner Urquell.

Na Spilce is the largest restaurant in the Czech Republic. And it’s underneath our brewery. Come five metres underground and have a look around. Na Spilce, Plzen. And did you know Na Spilce is in part of our old fermentation cellars?
Have you met Eva in the lab? What about Pavel in the cellars? Or Karel in the cooperage? See how they help to make our beer. The People of Pilsner Urquell.

"Pilsner Urquell is our only beer on draught and people seek us out for it. I like its heritage – it’s a true original – and they have high quality standards and use quality ingredients, just like HOP.” Galvin HOP. Galvin HOP, London.
Going over photos from a few weeks ago, enjoyable lunch and tour.

'Authentic' is an over-used word but when the štamgast have been here for three decades, and the waitress started working here long before that, then you know there's something special about a place. This is Prague's U Jelínků, the bar where time stood still. U Jelínků, Prague. The bar that still has the kind of atmosphere you can’t find anywhere else in Prague; an atmosphere of old, enjoyed today.

In Manchester, via Bavaria and Bohemia, is a ‘cook haus and bier palace' and the bar which pours the highest volume of tank Pilsner Urquell outside of the Czech Republic. This is the inimitable Alberts Schloss. Albert’s Schloss, Manchester. “Albert’s Schloss wants people to have fun. The atmosphere is incredible.”

“The future is very exciting. I’m trying to spread beer culture – focusing on quality first.”  

This is Adam Vlček, owner of Francis - Brewhemian Beer Café. In Plzeň he’s pouring great Pilsner Urquell alongside some of the best beers from small breweries around the Czech Republic. Francis Brewhemian Beer Café, Plzeň. “My great-grandfather Alexandr worked at Pilsner Urquell... I have a portrait of Alexandr in my bar to remind me of the beer quality my family have always strived for.”

“In the first week that the tanks were opened we were visited by an 85 year old man in a suit. He explained his grandsons had told him about our Pilsner Urquell tanks and he had to come as he had been to Plzeň in his youth and tried the beer there. We ended up drinking with him for a few hours. We suddenly knew we were onto something that was important to a lot of people." Anker’t, Budapest. Hungary's first tank beer is in a cool Budapest ruin bar.

“Everything around you is either from the brewery or designed to look like it is. I took thousands of photos so I could recreate them perfectly to give my bar an atmosphere just like the brewery.”

This is Prazdroj, in Bratislava, the first Tankovna pub outside of the Czech Republic. Prazdroj, Bratislava. “It’s not my job, it’s my hobby,” says Mr Murčo. “You must do this with your heart. And I’ve never once compromised on quality in 16 years.”

On the roof of a car park in Berlin, Klunkerkranich is the highest Tankovna bar and probably has the best view. What do you think? 

pilsnerurquell.com/article/klunkerkranich-berlin. Klunkerkranich, Berlin. “When we came up here, we didn’t see concrete, we saw light!"

Come and see what Total Ales found when they got to dig through the brewery's archives with Anna

http://www.totalales.co.uk/blog/2016/7/13/the-pilsner-people-chapter-3-the-archivist-anna-perinova. The Pilsner People – Chapter 3. The Archivist: Anna Perinova. Produced by Total Ales in collaboration with Pilsner Urquell Behind the main brewing facility, tucked next door to the old water tower, sits a modestly sized building, by Pilsner Urquell standards at least, that houses one of the brewery’s most important resources – its archives. Here I'm to meet An...

Come and join Total Ales as he takes a look around the brewery’s cooperage. The Pilsner People - Chapter 2. The Cooper: Jiri Fiala. Produced by Total Ales in collaboration with Pilsner Urquell It might seem strange to think that the Pilsner Urquell brewery still has a working cooperage. Many businesses as large as this might see it as an unnecessary expense. But the reason this cooperage still exists, which produces everything f...
From us in Plzen to you in your favourite bar, via the pouring skills of your bartender #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

It took decades to dig the 9km of tunnels beneath the brewery where the beer was once stored. Today you can see the cellars and drink a beer down there (which is still matured underground) on the brewery tour. Who's been? Timeline Photos.

Raise a beer to Jirka Koranda, who started working at the brewery in 1970. This is what he’s seen happen in the years that he’s been with us http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/people-pilsner-urquell-jirka-koranda. People of Pilsner Urquell: Jirka Koranda. 27 years in the brewhouse then many more working in the cellars... Jirka definitely knows a lot about Pilsner Urquell.
Not much has changed in the last century here at the brewery in Plzen (though we have a camera now) Timeline Photos.

This is how you announce you’re building a new brewery for your town in 1839

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/founding-document-pilsner-urquell. Timeline Photos.

With around 250 people having rights to brew, the people of Plzen made a big decision: they founded and funded a great new brewery for their town

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/community-founders. Timeline Photos.

What happened in the town of Plzen in the late 1830s to make the citizens decide to build their own brewery? 

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/plzen-pilsner-urquell. Timeline Photos.

Was Vaclav Mirwald the most influential man in creating a new town brewery for the citizens of Plzen? 

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/v%C3%A1clav-mirwald. Timeline Photos.

This is Jirka Koranda. He started working in the brewery in 1970. He was a brewer for 27 years. Today he manages the cellars #NaZdravi 

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/people-pilsner-urquell-jirka-koranda. People of Pilsner Urquell: Jirka Koranda. What can the man who's worked here for 45 years tell you about the brewery?

From tasting grain in malthouse to drinking beer in the cellars, here’s Beermaster Robert Lobovsky showing US chef Victoria Tonini around the brewery as she learns about the ingredients and processes that make Pilsner Urquell, all while she’s working on ideas for beer-inspired recipes. The Beermaster's Brewery Tour.

The original bar serving Pilsner Urquell in Prague was U Pinkasu, which has this unusual annual tradition that you won’t see anywhere else. It's Mr Pinkas' Nightmare Run

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/pinkas-nightmare-run. Mr Pinkas' Nightmare Run.
Have you ever walked through the brewery's anniversary gates in Plzen? Brewery Gates Hyperlapse.

With 140 countries represented, Milan Expo is a vibrant and exciting world fair. Come and have a look around #Expo2015 where Pilsner Urquell is pouring until October in the Czech Republic's pavilion. Milan Expo 2015.

Ever wanted to know what a tour of the brewery is like? This Life in Trips has written this great piece about his visit (it's going to make you thirsty...) #NaZdravi

http://www.thislifeintrips.com/pilsen-pilsner-urquell-brewery-tour-review/ The Grandfather of Beer: Pilsner Urquell Brewery Tour. Pilsen, home to the grandfather of beer. Read on for this Pilsner Urquell Brewery Tour review & why this historic spot should be on every beer lovers list.

Come on in and explore our brewery. See the cellars, step inside the old brewhouse, find the cooperage. This is #BreweryView

http://pilsnerurquell.com/brewery-tour. Brewery Tour. Where will you go on a tour of the brewery?

There’s the brewery cellars, the old brewhouse and the new one, the coopers' workshop, and more. This is #BreweryView and you can now explore our home in Plzen

http://pilsnerurquell.com/brewery-tour. Brewery View. Come on in and take a look around our brewery!
Been on a tour of our brewery in Plzen? If not then here are some of things you’ve missed… #PilsnerWorld. Pilsner Urquell Brewery Tour.
From the brewery gates up to the water tower, not much has changed at the brewery over the years. Timeline Photos.

Want to know where to head for beer in our hometown of Plzen? 

pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/pubs-plzen. Pubs of Plzen. Here's a look at some of the best places for a beer in Plzen. Do you have any other favourites?
This is Plzen’s Town Hall. Outside of this in 1838, 36 barrels of bad beer were poured away. Soon after the citizens decided to build one new brewery for the whole town. Timeline Photos.

In the past the brewery produced some elaborate calendars, distributing them to pubs and bars. Here are five from the archives ranging from 1894 to 1913. Do you have a favourite? Pilsner Urquell Vintage Calendars.

Concerned his customers weren't getting served their beer quickly enough, Mr Pinkas demanded his staff run from the cellar to the tables carrying mugs of beer. Now, once a year, bartenders at U Pinkasu race to see who can climb the 45 stairs carrying 10 beers in the fastest time. It’s the Pinkas Nightmare Run!

TRAILER: Pinkas Nightmare Run

The challenge is to run up 45 steps, from the cellar of U Pinkasu to the bar, carrying 10 beers in the fastest time... It’s the Pinkas Nightmare Run and the full video is coming soon!

Jan Hlavacek is a fifth-generation brewmaster and one of the most important brewers in our history. Find out why...

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/people-pilsner-urquell-jan-hlavacek. People of Pilsner Urquell: Jan Hlavacek. Born into a family of brewers, find out how Jan Hlavacek managed to maintain the quality of Pilsner Urquell...

If you're drinking your Pilsner Urquell from a bottle or can then Vaclav Simek is the man who made that happen. Here's more about his job as Packaging Hall Manager

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/people-pilsner-urquell-vaclav-simek . People of Pilsner Urquell: Vaclav Simek. Here's Packaging Hall Manager Vaclav Simek - born in Plzen, he's now responsible for all the beer that's put into bottles and cans.

It takes just four natural ingredients to make beer, so as the barley and hop harvests approach here's a look at those ingredients and what qualities they can give to beer

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/ingredients-beer . The Ingredients of Beer. Combine water, grain, hops and yeast and you can make delicious beer!

If you like beer from tankovna pubs then Lukas Princ is a man you should know about because it's his job to make sure those tanks get filled with fresh beer. Find out more about his work and what he does outside of the brewery

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/people-pilsner-urquell-lukas-princ . People of Pilsner Urquell: Lukas Princ. If you like tankovna beer then you .

It's Jan's job to pour the pints in Pivnice Konvikt and he tells us what's great about his work and his secret to serving the best beer

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/meet-bartender-jan-bejkovec . Meet the Bartender: Jan Bejkovec. Here we begin a new series of posts introducing you to bartenders around the world, starting with Jan who works in the Konvikt Bar, Prague.

This is former brewmaster Ivo Hlaváček and the story of how he ensured our traditional brewing methods have always remained the same:

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/people-pilsner-urquell-ivo-hlavacek. People of Pilsner Urquell: Ivo Hlaváček. Meet the former brewmaster Ivo Hlaváček and read the story of how he was responsible for keeping the traditions of Pilsner Urquell alive.

Jirka Koranda joined the brewery as an apprentice in 1970 and has worked here ever since. Today he's in charge of the beers we produce in the cellars. Let's head underground and meet the man who has worked at Pilsner Urquell for over 44 years

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/people-pilsner-urquell-jirka-koranda . People of Pilsner Urquell: Jirka Koranda. With over 44 years of service, Jirka Koranda recently received a special award from the brewery.

In Plzen and want to know the best places to drink? Here's the guide for you!

Who has visited any of these bars or restaurants?  

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/pubs-plzen . Pubs of Plzen. Want to know where to drink if you're in Plzen?

The brewery used to have apartments onsite where workers lived. They also planted orchards and allotments and grew their own fruit and vegetables. Here's what it was like: http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/brewery-gardens. The Brewery Gardens. With apples, pears and plums growing, the brewery gardens were a great place to take a small harvest of fresh fruit.
Here’s what one day at the brewery looks like, including a visit to the cellars, the malting, the cooperage and the brewhouse. A Day In The Life Of The Brewery.

The brewery workers in Plzen have their own pub. Join us
for a beer in Formanka: http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/formanka-brewery-workers%E2%80%99-bar. Timeline Photos.

Every Friday at 2pm, Robert Lobovsky phoned us to try and get a job in his home town brewery. It took four months of persistence before he finally got that job. A few years later and today he's the 'Beer Master'. Read the great story about how he got there

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/people-pilsner-urquell-robert-lobovsky. People of Pilsner Urquell: Robert Lobovsky. From Plzen to Australia and back again, meet Robert Lobovsky, Pilsner Urquell's 'Beer Master'

We enjoyed a fantastic launch of our newest Tankovna pub  at the Strongroom Bar with plenty of friends attending including our very own Vaclav. Take a look at the photos from 2014’s first Tankovna launch. Na Zdravi! 

http://youtu.be/1yHo76gj3Os. Pilsner Urquell: Tankovna Launch Strongroom Bar & Kitchen. To celebrate the second UK Pilsner Urquell Tankovna bar launch at The Strongroom Bar & Kitchen, we headed down to give drinkers the chance to taste our fines...

Pilsner Urquell Tankovna Launch: Strongroom Bar & Kitchen.

Please enjoy Pilsner Urquell responsibly.  Visit www.TalkingAlcohol.com for more info. Pilsner Urquell Tankovna Launch: Strongroom Bar & Kitchen.

What’s the best pale lager in the world?

The annual RateBeer Best results say that it’s Pilsner Urquell Nefiltrovany! That's the beer you drink in the brewery cellars at the end of the tour (you can also get it in Na Parkanu in Plzen and very occasionally in other places). Who’s drunk it?

The rest of the lists are also really good – have a look: http://www.ratebeer.com/RateBeerBest/ByStyle_012014.asp 
. top beers, brewers, new brewers by subregion - ratebeer best 2014.

This is Honza. He's one of the tour guides at the brewery in Plzen and we think that he knows everything there is to know about Pilsner Urquell! 

Here's his story: http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/people-pilsner-urquell-honza-dienstbier. Timeline Photos.
Had the first snow of the year in Plzen today (in case we need an excuse to head to the pub to warm up and have a beer…) Timeline Photos.

Brewmaster Vaclav Berka has the best job in the world: he gets to taste the beer every day!
#NaZdravi to Josef Groll and Vaclav Berka, the man who brewed the original pilsner in 1842 and the man who still makes it today.
Groll crafted the unique taste of the Pilsner Urquell we know and love today that continues to be brewed by our master brewer Vaclav Berka.
Vaclav Berka is the senior trade brewmaster and chairman of the supervisory board of Pilsner Urquell.
messages:
How did Vaclav Berka become our Brewmaster? Here he explains to Huffington Post

"When I received training from my previous predecessors, they all told me, 'Don't make changes in the recipe, the ingredients or the process. Be sure the taste of the beer is the same as before.' This is very important, because this is how we reproduce the same Pilsner Urquell that was brewed in the 19th century.

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/lan-anh-vu/how-i-got-there-vaclav-be_b_9162964.html. How I Got There: Vaclav Berka. Vaclav Berka is the senior trade brewmaster and chairman of the supervisory board of Pilsner Urquell. One of the most famous beers in the world, Pilsner Urquell, is brewed in Pilsner in the Czec...
It’s nearly Christmas so here’s a message from Brewmaster Vaclav Berka #NaZdravi. Merry Christmas from Brewmaster Vaclav!
Brewmaster Vaclav Berka has the most important job this afternoon: he has to check the beer #NaZdravi. Brewmaster Vaclav Berka.

By brewing the #OriginalPilsner, Josef Groll became a legend in the beer world. But who was he?

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/josef-groll. Timeline Photos.
In 1842, Josef Groll travelled to Plzen where he changed beer forever #NaZdravi. The Ingredients of Pilsner Urquell.
#NaZdravi to Josef Groll and Vaclav Berka, the man who brewed the original pilsner in 1842 and the man who still makes it today. Timeline Photos.
From Josef Groll through to Vaclav Berka, our brewmasters pass the Pilsner Urquell recipe on with a simple message: Never change it. Timeline Photos.

In 1842 Josef Groll travelled to Plzen from his hometown of Vilshofen in Bavaria. It was a journey that would change beer forever when he brewed the world’s original golden lager.

A few months ago our German friends recreated Groll’s journey, meeting craftsmen along the way. This is Josef’s Way. Josef's Way.
Josef Groll came to Plzen in 1842 and, with four simple ingredients, he changed beer forever #NaZdravi. The Ingredients of Pilsner Urquell.
Brewmaster Vaclav Berka has the best job in the world: he gets to taste the beer every day! #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

The greatest job in the world? Past brewmasters taste Pilsner Urquell every day to check it’s the best it can be!

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/parallel-brewing. Timeline Photos.

With a table of different malts and hops, plus a classic Pilsner recipe to follow, six teams brewed six different Pilsner-style beers. But which one did Brewmaster Vaclav Berka judge to be the best?

http://youtu.be/bR9_ZcbeZBM. Pilsner Urquel Brew Off. Six teams each brewed a Pilsner-style beer under the guidance of Brewmaster Vaclav Berka. Using a range of different ingredients, the teams created their own...

In May, Brewmaster Vaclav Berka taught six different teams how to brew their own versions of a Pilsner. Six weeks later they all returned to taste and judge their beers. But who brewed the best beer?

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/brew-judging . Brew Off Judging. Six teams and six different pilsners, but which was the best?

With sacks of malt and bags of hops, we’ve got six teams all competing to make the best pilsner they can, with help from our Brewmaster Vaclav Berka. It’s Brew Off! http://youtu.be/9enLcE1Oxs0. Pilsner Urquell Brew Off. Who will make the best pilsner?

World famous beer festival Oktoberfest starts tomorrow in Munich. Did you know Bavaria is where our original master brewer Josef Groll learnt his trade – he perfected his craft in Plzen to create the first golden Pilsner. Timeline Photos.

Today we're raising a glass to the original Pilsner brewer, Josef Groll, who was born 200 years ago today. Groll crafted the unique taste of the Pilsner Urquell we know and love today that continues to be brewed by our master brewer Vaclav Berka. Timeline Photos.

summary:
When the making of Pilsner Urquell moved from wooden barrels into new tanks we had to ensure the taste didn’t change, so we started the process of 'Parallel Brewing' and years later it’s still done, with past and present brewmasters judging the results

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/parallel-brewing
.

It's susceptible to pests and disease, it only pops out... Here in Plzen we’ve been using the same yeast to make our beer since 1842, so it’s fascinating to read this great story in The New York Times about microbiologists and brewers looking into the DNA of beer yeast.

This is what it takes to be the best bartender and pour perfect pints of Pilsner 

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/ota-haurythun-master-pilsner-pourer.

Here in Plzen we’ve been using the same yeast to make our beer since 1842, so it’s fascinating to read this great story in The New York Times about microbiologists and brewers looking into the DNA of beer yeast. And did you know that yeasts can produce over 500 different aromas and flavours?

Hi everyone! This is Mark Dredge and I’m Pilsner Urquell’s Beer Correspondent. It’s my job to tell the many great stories and happenings at the brewery and to talk with you about beer (before you ask: yes, my mates are all jealous that I’ve got the best job in the world). When I’m not here, I write a beer blog, I love to travel to drink the best beers I can find, and I’ve also written two books about beer: Craft Beer World and Beer & Food. I’ve already been working on some exciting stories from the brewery and I’m looking forward to sharing them with you.
Our beer has lived through two world wars, unification and revolutions. Yet it maintains its unique taste and brewing process. Timeline Photos.

We’ve selected our International Master Bartender 2013 – Frantisek Stastka, the first winner from America. He fought off tough competition during the final stages of the contest held this weekend at our annual Pilsner Fest for the first time. Timeline Photos.

This month we will be launching a ‘Parallel Brewers’ challenge.  

Intrigued? 

Most of you will know that our Brew Master Václav regularly checks our beer against a sample batch of beer brewed using the original wooden barrels, to make sure it matches perfectly to the original brew. 

He’s going to be challenging you to try your own version of this unique technique…. barrels at the ready! 

If you are a budding home brewer then stay posted and we'll let you know more soon…. Timeline Photos.

The brewery in Plzen was originally built to make beer for the town. When that beer was ready, it was put into barrels and then loaded onto carts pulled by horses and delivered to the local taverns. Even though the horses were eventually replaced, that old method of delivery is one of those important traditions that we’ve kept going in Plzen and we continue to load a cart a few days a week to take beer to a few of the prominent local pubs, as well as stopping at some of the main sights in the city. So meet Jana Micova, the cart driver, and her two horses: Barna and Byka, both eight-year-old fillies, as they deliver beer in Plzen. Horse and Cart Beer Deliveries in Plzen.
Delivering the fresh taste of Pilsner Urquell direct from our brewery. Timeline Photos.

In Czech Republic this weekend? Head down to Pilsner Fest, our annual celebration of the original Pilsner held at our brewery in Pilsen. The ultimate place to enjoy a glass of Pilsner Urquell alongside good food and music. We're also crowning our International Master Bartender 2013.
We’re cheering on our home side FC Viktoria Plzeň with a pint of the original Pilsner as they take on Manchester City FC - Official in the UEFA Champions League. Good luck boys!

The White Horse - European Beer Festival

Please enjoy Pilsner Urquell responsibly. Visit www.TalkingAlcohol.com for more info. The White Horse - European Beer Festival.

Next week savour the unique taste of Pilsner Urquell at White Horse on Parson's Green, London for their European Beer Festival, and have your chance to pour your own Czech style serve! Look out for more information. Timeline Photos.

Ever tasted unpasteurised and unfiltered Pilsner Urquell direct from an oak barrel? London Beer Guide describes it as ‘outstanding’. Here’s what they thought: http://www.londonbeerguide.co.uk/2013/08/beer-event-pilsner-urquell-nefiltrovany.html. London Beer Guide: Beer Event: Pilsner Urquell Nefiltrovaný in London. Here we write about beer in London, breweries in London, beer events in London, etc. And we also tweet via @LondonBeerGuide. Enjoy.

Our Brew Master, Vaclav Berka, was at the European Beer Bloggers conference in Edinburgh a couple of weeks ago. Here’s what Billy from Billy's Booze Blog thought of the unpasteurised and unfiltered Pilsner Urquell we were serving up 
http://bbblog.org.uk/2013/08/pilsner-urquell-filtered-and-unfiltered-ebbc13/ Pilsner Urquell: Filtered and Unfiltered - #EBBC13. Head to head - the regular Pilsner Urquell and its unrefined, unfiltered, no-CO2-added brother, poured from a wooden cask.

Near London this week? Taste the original Pilsner, unpasteurised and unfiltered, at one of the bars or pubs hosting our limited edition 25 litre Oak Barrels http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/wooden-barrel-events. Timeline Photos.
We are at the Taste Of London festival today, come down and say hello, and have a drink from the tank! http://pilsnerurquell.com/gb/article/taste-london-festival-finally-here. Timeline Photos.

Don’t forget the Tank launch at White Horse on Parson's Green, London tomorrow – we’ve got some pics of the tanks being installed. All being well, Vaclav – our Brew Master, will be at the pub, demonstrating the perfect pour. Timeline Photos.

summary: In the Czech Republic, the two most important people in the pub are the chef and the Tapster.

The mentality of the Tapster: Every drinker is equal and every beer has to be perfect #NaZdravi

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/perfect-beer-and-prague-history-u-pinkasů.

“The two most important people in a Czech pub are the Tapster and the chef, which is why I want to be a Tapster forever,” says Tomáš, the man who pours 1,000 beers a day at Lokál U Bílé Kuželky, Prague.
But then it is some of the best-served beer in the whole of the Czech Republic.

“I love it when people come up to me and say, ‘this is the perfect beer.’ It gives me the most pleasure and is the reason why I do what I do.” Did you know that some Tapsters have developed their own signature pour?
messages:
Lokal Hamburk is one of our favourite pubs in Prague. A little out of the way, but always worth it for the fresh, tasty Pilsner. 
http://pilsnerurquell.com/us/article/prague%E2%80%99s-best-pubs-lok%C3%A1l-hamburk. Timeline Photos.
In the Czech Republic, the two most important people in the pub are the chef and the Tapster. If you want the best beer then you'll go to the best Tapster #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

Find out what makes a Tapster, a Tapster. 
It takes dedication, and an on-going commitment to serving the perfect pint of Pilsner Urquell every time, and that’s only the beginning.
http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/beer-master-and-tapster-programme.
He's tempted to keep this one for himself… But a great Tapster makes sure every beer is perfect, every time #NaZdravi. Timeline Photos.

“The Tapsters really make the pub – my customers come for their exceptional service and the way they look after the beer. It’s not an easy beer either, it can taste different in different bars but some people don’t care. My customers do. We now serve one of the best beers in Prague.” Na Hradčanské, Prague. “The secret to a good bar is simple. Serve good beer and serve good food. Together it creates a great atmosphere."

Being a Štamgast is like being a bar's 'regular' only much more important. Here's what it means in the Czech Republic…. Czech Pub Culture: The Štamgast. Štamgast is a title bestowed in Czech pubs to only the most faithful regulars, the people who have been coming to the same pub for years.
For 174 years, U Pinkasu has been serving Pilsner Urquell in Prague. It's a pub with perfect Pilsner, great Tapsters and a brilliant back story. Perfect Beer and Prague History in U Pinkasů.
Take a closer look at your beer… Has the Tapster left their signature? The Tapster's Signature.

If our Brewmaster is a štamgast in your pub then you must be doing something right. Here’s what makes Prague's Konvikt great. Konvikt, Prague. “I can’t explain why one bar is famous for its beer while others aren’t. We look after all the little details, so our pub has a different feeling to others. And when you do that, people will find you.”

At The Golden Tiger, the Tapster just pours. He barely even looks at the beer he’s pouring. It is said a good Tapster “feels their beer”. The Tapsters in this pub are some of the best there are. U Zlatého Tygra, Prague. This is a Czech bar for Czech beer lovers. So grab a seat, if you can find one, settle in and enjoy an atmosphere as good as the Pilsner Urquell.

"Not everyone can be a Tapster – people need time to become good and not everyone has the patience.” Michal clearly has what it takes as he’s been a Tapster for 17 years! Kolkovna, Prague. "At Kolkovna we pride ourselves on our beer. Our customers drink five or six 50 litre kegs a day. We can’t get tank beer in this building so we serve the best keg beer we can."

The mentality of the Tapster: Every drinker is equal and every beer has to be perfect #NaZdravi

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/perfect-beer-and-prague-history-u-pinkasů. Timeline Photos.

Why should you visit Na Hradčanské? Because the beer's so good it's where Prague's Tapsters go to drink #NaZdravi. Na Hradčanské, Prague. “The Tapsters really make the pub–my customers come for their exceptional service and the way they look after the beer. It’s not an easy beer either, it can taste different in different bars but some people don’t care. My customers do care."
“Anyone can learn to be a Tapster but a Tapster can’t be anyone. You need passion and love,” says Klára, Tapster at Brno’s Lokál. Timeline Photos.

"It’s difficult to drink beer anywhere else because here it is perfect – the best!"

It's Ota's job to ensure that every beer at U Pinkasů *is* the best. Here’s what that means to him in the Prague pub that’s been serving Pilsner Urquell since 1843. Perfect Beer and Prague History in U Pinkasů. “It’s my mission to make beer the same everywhere as it is in U Pinkasů,” he says. “It doesn’t matter who is the guest, it has to be perfect. There should be no compromise ever.” .

The Beer Master trains all the Pilsner Urquell Tapsters. Here's why the programme matters and why perfect Pilsner pours are important to us. The Beer Master and the Tapster Programme. "We’re giving [Tapsters] the skills to serve beer that’s as fresh and delicious as it is here at the brewery. That means beer lovers can taste the best beer possible.”

You’ll never see a pub with more hippopotamuses in it than Prague’s U Hrocha!

pilsnerurquell.com/article/u-hrocha-prague. U Hrocha, Prague. The hippopotamus is deemed indestructible and a survivor, like this pub in an ever-changing Prague.

“The two most important people in a Czech pub are the Tapster and the chef, which is why I want to be a Tapster forever,” says Tomáš, the man who pours 1,000 beers a day at Lokál U Bílé Kuželky, Prague. Lokál U Bílé Kuželky, Prague. “I love it when people come up to me and say, ‘this is the perfect beer.’ It gives me the most pleasure and is the reason why I do what I do.”

Did you know that some Tapsters have developed their own signature pour? Look closer next time you have a Pilsner…

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/tapsters-signature. The Tapster's Signature.

“A great tapster is made from demanding customers. When you have customers who are demanding, they make the perfect beer.” This is Honza, Tapster at Brno’s U Bláhovky

www.pilsnerurquell.com/article/u-bláhovky-brno. U Bláhovky, Brno. Every day U Bláhovky sells one full tank of Pilsner Urquell (that's 600 litres in a pub with just 50 seats). But then it is some of the best-served beer in the whole of the Czech Republic.
Try telling this Czech Tapster that you'd like your glass topped up. He wouldn't do it because this is right for his Pilsner. He's Czech, he knows best #betterwithfoam. Timeline Photos.

"Czech consumers would never accept badly poured beer."

It's Jan's job as a Tapster to share perfectly poured Pilsners with people around the world. He even has a beer tap with his name on it. Thanks to Total Ales for telling seven great stories about our beer and brewery.

http://www.totalales.co.uk/blog/2016/8/12/the-pilsner-people-chapter-7-the-tapster-jan-stanik. The Pilsner People – Chapter 7. The Tapster: Jan Stanik. Produced by Total Ales in collaboration with Pilsner Urquell If you’re listening to music right now the chances are you’re streaming it from an online subscription service or playing an MP3 file, am I right? If you are then you’re not doing the recording you’re listening to justice. It takes a lot o...

A quirk of Czech drinking, are the Štamgasts the most important people in a Czech pub? Here’s what it means to be a Štamgast and why they won’t settle for anything less than a perfect Pilsner

www.pilsnerurquell.com/article/czech-pub-culture-štamgast. Czech Pub Culture: The Štamgast. “Czechs won’t drink bad beer. If you serve bad beer then the message travels quickly and people won’t go back to you." It's the Štamgasts who will be the ones who judge the quality.

Trust your Tapster! Here's how we're training people to pour proper Pilsners, just like we do it in Plzen 

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/learning-serve-journey-tapster-status. Learning to serve: the journey to Tapster status. Pouring perfect glasses of Pilsner is very important to us. This is why it matters and what we're doing about it.

Animals, people, places... Here's our guide to understanding Czech pub names. Do you have a favourite Czech pub? #NaZdravi

http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/czech-pub-names-what-do-they-mean. Czech Pub Names: What Do They Mean? At Salzmann's? At The Hippopotamus? In The Fermentation Cellar?  .

Ticks, crosses, M’s and V’s. What’s the deal with the barman drawing on your beer mat? #NaZdravi http://pilsnerurquell.com/article/czech-pub-experience-how-it-all-adds. The Czech Pub Experience: How It All Adds Up. The beermat is for more than just resting your beer on.

How many of these classic pubs have you been to in Prague? Do you have a favourite?

http://pilsnerurquell.com/uk/article/classic-pubs-prague
. Classic Pubs of Prague. This is where to drink if you want to visit a classic Prague pub.
